multiple-choice.question:
Elisa Kazan's neighborhood pub serves 8 different types of cider; denote these types by $C_1,C_2,\dots,C_8$. Elisa invites 7 friends to this pub and orders one cider for each friend. Different friends may get the same type of cider. (Elisa came by car and, therefore, orders a glass of water for herself.)
In how many ways can Elisa place these orders of cider, such that exactly 4 of her friends get a cider of type $C_3$?
